newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco milk output up 2.5 pct in 1995/96 season.
newsitem.headline: Morocco milk output up 2.5 pct in 1995/96 season.

text.p: Morocco's milk output reached 900 million litres in 1995/96, up 2.5 percent over the previous season, an agriculture ministry official said on Wednesday.

"The good results of 1995/96 agricultural season had a positive impact on Morocco's milk production. It rose 2.5 percent to 900 million litres in the period compared with the 1994/95 season," the official said.
Moroccco, which expects an estimated 11 percent economic growth in 1996 due largely to the agriculture sector, suffered from severe drought in 1995.
Several shops in Rabat have reported shortages of milk in recent weeks. The ministry said milk production meets an average 85 percent of domestic demand.
The difference is mainly met by imports of 13,000 tonnes of milk powder, mostly from Europe.
